Case reference: 2015011654.CaseDesc: On December 3, 1994, a baby was found in the Rivière des Prairies between the island of Montréal and the Visitation park Island in the Ahuntsic neighborhood. The body was naked and had a plastic bag wrapped around the wrist. According to experts the body would have been in the water since the fall.

Case reference: 2015049499.CaseDesc: Loretta Garrett's husband and friends reported her missing on July 19, 1961. They were on a fishing trip near the mouth of the Moose Brook River in Northesk Parish, New Brunswick. The four of them shared a car and parked near the trailhead. The men hiked across a trail until they reached the water to fish. The women remained in the car. Shortly after, Loretta complained about the heat and bugs and started down the same trail as the men, but she was never seen again.

Case reference: 2014001191.CaseDesc: On April 22, 2010, the body of an unidentified man was found in the Richelieu River in Saint-Mathias-sur-Richelieu, Quebec. In his possession were a Hipstreet brand MP3 player and headphones. The images shown are facial approximation portraits of this unidentified man created by the Sûreté du Québec.

Case reference: 2014005555.CaseDesc: In April, 2000, Magdalena Ciesek was last seen in Toronto, Ontario at the intersection of Dundas Street W. and Roncesvalles Avenue.

Case reference: 2006006699.CaseDesc: Eric Larsfolk and John McCormick were last seen playing at the McCormick farm in Caledon. They have not been seen since.

Case reference: 2006004799.CaseDesc: Ralph Monague and Curtis Smith were passengers on the Christian Island Ferry travelling between Cedar Point and Christian Island on December 22, 1985, when they fell over board in stormy conditions.

Case reference: 2014004021.CaseDesc: On July 10th, 1998, Ronald Oxley was last seen leaving his residence in Thompson Manitoba. He told friends he was going to the bank and then to the grocery store. Mr. Oxley has not been seen or heard from since.

Scar: Nose, One inch long, left side

Case reference: 2012020165.CaseDesc: The remains of this male were found in a forested area immediately north of the Port Coquitlam cemetery.

Teeth: Visible Decay, Missing an upper front tooth on the left side prior to death. The upper front tooth on the right side was angled.
Deformity: Left Knee, Osgoode-Schlatter's disease - bony bump on shin below knee

Case reference: 2011002599.CaseDesc: On May 29, 1998, Marcus Schmidseder walked away from his family’s home in Mississauga. Marcus’s intended destination is unknown; there was a possible sighting of him in Massey, Ontario on June 9, 1998. He may have been attempting to make his way to the western provinces.

Case reference: 2013000012.CaseDesc: Cameron March was last seen by his mother on May 7, 1975, at approximately 3:15 p.m. He was playing on a swing set in a next door neighbour's yard located on Blind Line in the City of Burlington, Ontario. Cameron followed the adult neighbour into the residence and asked to play with a friend. When told the friend was sleeping, Cameron left the residence, walking towards his house.

Teeth: Braces, Braces on lower left side of teeth.  One top tooth discolored.
Shirt: White, T-shirt with green band around collar. Brown and green monkeys climbing on front.

Case reference: 2017017369.CaseDesc: On August 5, 1986, the mutilated body of an adult male believed to be between the ages of 20-25 was found on the railway line near Highway 20 in Dorval, Quebec. The man was reportedly seen lying on the railroad tracks.

Case reference: 2014005084.CaseDesc: On February 1, 2008, it is suspected the Kevin Leroux went through the ice on his ATV, near St Joseph's Cove, NL. His ATV was recovered several months later, about 22 km from where he was suspected of going through the ice but his body was never found.

Case reference: 2014005207.CaseDesc: On June 01, 2008, Bartholomew MacIsaac was seen for the last time in Calgary, Alberta.

Case reference: 2015011664.CaseDesc: On July 6, 1994, the body of an adult male believed to be between the ages of 25-35 was found in the waters of the St. Lawrence River near the Old Port of Montreal Clock Tower in Montreal, Quebec.

Sweater: Cotton, Purple, Lavender, Mauve, Fruit of the Loom brand, T-shirt with short sleeves, faded, size medium
Scar: Right Hand, 2.4 cm at the base of the thumb

Case reference: 2014005110.CaseDesc: On June 3, 2008, at approximately 9:25 p.m., Jaquelyn Latto was seen for the last time as she left the Juliette Place Shelter in Toronto, Ontario. Jaquelyn had told the staff at the shelter that she was going out with her brother.

Case reference: 2018071052.CaseDesc: On July 11, 1998, the remains of a male individual were discovered on Sulphur Mountain in Banff National Park. There is dental work present, including multiple fillings. The post-mortem interval is estimated to be between 6 months and 5 years.

Case reference: 2014005443.CaseDesc: Paolo Renda was last seen on May 20, 2010 in the Montréal-Nord borough of Montréal. His vehicle was later located on Gouin Street in Montreal. Paolo has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2012020050.CaseDesc: Shirley Lonethunder originally from White Bear First Nation near Carlyle, SK went missing from downtown Saskatoon, SK on the afternoon of December 24, 1991.

Case reference: 2014003135.CaseDesc: On March 28, 1986, Herman Yahyahkeekoot was last seen at his residence, a farm which was a group home.  Mr. Yahyahkeekoot had a history of wandering away from the home. The location is close to the Nesbit Forest which was searched, however, he was never located.

Case reference: 2014005770.CaseDesc: On August 29, 1979, Thomas Lidguerre and Lawrence Sanger headed out from Fond du Lac to Uranium City on Lake Athabaska, Saskatchewan. The boat was located two days later, swamped near the Narrows and Popular Point. A search was conducted and lasted for over one month without any success in locating Thomas and Lawrence.

Case reference: 2014003814.CaseDesc: On April 27, 1980, Leon Kitchekesik and his parents were staying at their cabin on Gull Lake. Leon was walking along the shore with his three year old sister. The parents went to investigate when they heard the screams of their daughter. The parents located footprints approaching a small hole and none leading away from the hole. There was a land search conducted however it is felt the boy drowned.

Case reference: 2012020061.CaseDesc: On the evening of October 17, 2008, Amber Mcfarland went to Smitty's lounge with her boyfriend and an acquaintance of his. There they socialized with friends for a while and then moved to the bar at the Canad Inn. They left Amber's vehicle at the Canad Inn and went to the Cat and Fiddle Bar where they continued to socialize. Video surveillance at the bar confirms that shortly after 1:00 am on October 18, 2008, Amber, her boyfriend and his acquaintance entered the attached beer vendor and purchased a case of beer. The three of them exited the vendor and walked into the parking lot. Amber has not been seen or heard from since. All of Amber's cell phone activity and bank activity has since ceased.

Purse: White, Black, Checkered or plaid pattern

Case reference: 2017045193.CaseDesc: On July 18, 2017, Walter Allan left his residence to attend a coin collecting conference in Montreal, Quebec.  Walter did not attend the conference and on July 21, 2017, was last seen on security footage near Iberville, Quebec. Walter's vehicle was later located on August 24, 2017, in a field near Saint-Barthelemy, Quebec.

Case reference: 2014004667.CaseDesc: The Gypsumville RCMP detachment received a report that an aircraft was in distress over Lake Winnipeg near Reindeer Island. The aircraft, a single engine Cherokee 140, had three people on board; the pilot and two passengers. The pilot had indicated that the engine had seized and that he was trying to make it to Reindeer Island. He then stated that he was going down in to the water. Two RCMP Twin Otters and an Air Search and Rescue Hercules conducted a search by air. It was not possible to search the lake by boat as there was too much ice on the lake. All three are presumed dead due to drowning or from the impact of the crash.

Case reference: 2013000025.CaseDesc: On May 28, 1998, Darwin Sylvester was seen for the last time at approximately 23:00 hrs. He called his girlfriend shortly after midnight on May 29th. Darwin had plans to meet with an associate for breakfast, however he never showed for the meeting. His belongings and luggage were all located at the residence on Chalmers. He has not had any contact with friends or family since.

Tattoo: Left Arm, "Spartans MC in Memory of" (text)

Case reference: 2014006004.CaseDesc: On February 1, 2013, Timmothy Benedict-Leaf was last seen at his family residence in Akwesasne, Ontario.

Case reference: 2023030253.CaseDesc: Autumn Shaganash was last seen on June 10, 2023.  She has had no activity on her bank account, no money on her person, and no cellphone. Autumn, according to her immediate family, suffers from depression and anxiety and must take prescribed medication on a daily basis. She hasn't taken her medication since.

Case reference: 2014004949.CaseDesc: On June 3, 1968, it was reported that George Knott had been missing since the previous day. He had been traveling by boat between St. Theresa and Garden Hill, Manitoba. George's boat and dog were located. All attempts to locate him failed and he remains missing.

Scar: Left Shin, 1 inch lateral scar across left shin - axe wound
Left Knee, 1.5 inch lateral scar across inside left knee - axe wound
Left Foot, 1.5 inch lateral scar across top left foot - axe wound
1 inch lateral scar inside of right or left foot - axe wound

Case reference: 2014004872.CaseDesc: Andre Lemieux was last seen on January 9, 2007 in Montreal. He brought his child to daycare and has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2013000120.CaseDesc: In the early morning hours of June 30, 2002, Lisa Marie Young was seen for the last time in Nanaimo, British Columba. On the night of June 29, Lisa travelled to a local bar, and met with some acquaintances. Lisa and her acquaintances accepted a ride from a man to an afterparty. Subsequently, Lisa left with this male driver to get some food, but communicated to her acquaintances that she would be returning to them via taxi. She has not been seen or heard from since. Based on investigational information, the Nanaimo RCMP Serious Crime Unit believes that she may have been met with foul play. Police request that anyone with information contact them directly.

Jewelry: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Hoop necklace with medallion
Tattoo: Right Arm, Band of flowers with heart

Case reference: 2012020107.CaseDesc: Isabelle Bourgeot, 32, was seen for the last time on November 1st, 1985 in the La Cité-Limoilou district in Quebec City, Quebec. At the time of her disappearance Isabelle wasn’t carrying any identification papers. It should be noted that she suffers from amnesia.

Case reference: 2014001524.CaseDesc: Matthew Leblanc was last seen by his sister on the morning of September 22, 1999, after he had coffee with her. Matthew was last observed at the bus stop located at the intersection of Superior/Menzies Street in Victoria. Matthew failed to attend an afternoon appointment and has not been heard or seen from since.

Case reference: 2014004358.CaseDesc: On August 5, 2003 Rahul Arora was last seen leaving the Trappers Inn in Parry Sound, Ontario.  He was possibly heading to the Toronto area to catch a flight.

Hair: Black, Straight, Ear length, parted in middle, dyed copper

Case reference: 2014002458.CaseDesc: On September 4, 1986, Rozebeh Kiani was seen for the last time in the Shaughnessy Village district of Montreal, Quebec. Rozebeh left all his personal belongings behind in his apartment and it is possible he may have travelled to Vancouver, British Columbia. Rozebeh speaks very little French or English.

Case reference: 2014005317.CaseDesc: On October 23, 1996, Sabrina John was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Sabrina’s parents had gotten into an argument that night, and the following day she and her mother had left their home with their clothing.

Case reference: 2014001558.CaseDesc: Louis Cochrane was reported missing when his family became concerned about his absence as he had a history of memory loss and a history of running into the bush and/or wandering off. An intensive search of the land proved unsuccessful. A set of footprints were found leading into the water of the river and an intensive operation involving the drilling of 10 holes through the ice in the area failed to yield any evidence. Louis' whereabouts remain unknown.

Teeth: 2 molars absent on upper right side
Fractured/Broken Bones: Left Arm, Left arm in cast

Case reference: 2016060952.CaseDesc: On October 2, 2016, Gaétan Roy was seen for the last time at his residence in Quebec City, Quebec. He left with a considerable amount of his personal effects and without saying where he was going. His credit cards were last used on October 6, 2016, in the Calgary, Alberta area. Gaétan is known to be despondent and he is familiar with western Canada and National Parks.

Mark: Left Forearm, Burn on the lower part
Right Forearm, Burn on the lower part

Case reference: 2014003491.CaseDesc: On June 12th, 1981, Gordon Westover was seen at a local beer garden in Fort St John, BC at approximately 11:00 PM. Mr. Westover left the gathering in an unknown direction and has not been seen or heard from since. Mr. Westover has a mild mental disability and has been known to impersonate professional people such as police, firefighters, military and doctors. Mr. Westover told several people at the party that he was going to join the military, but no records show Mr. Westover was ever recruited. Mr. Westover has not been seen or heard from.

Case reference: 2008245047.CaseDesc: Jadon may be in the company of his non-custodial mother Roxana Eliana YANEZ PARADA.

Case reference: 2009002599.CaseDesc: Mark Mayhew was residing with family at a residence in Sturgeon Falls. He left overnight without notice. There was no incident which upset him and caused him to leave. Mark was on foot, he had no vehicle and no known destination.

Teeth: False, No teeth; had false teeth but was not wearing them at the time.

Case reference: 2019054192.CaseDesc: Danick Bourgeois was seen for the last time during the month of July 2019. He has been known to reside in a homemade trailer in St. Bernadin, Ontario and in a tent near Hawkesbury, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014002260.CaseDesc: On February 20, 1993, William Kacuiba was operating a snowmobile on the North Saskatchewan River near Prince Albert, Saskatchewan. He and his snowmobile went through open ice and subsequent searches of the water and area, including air searches, failed to locate William.

Pants: Black, Snowmobile; possible yellow stripe down the sides
Scar: Left Hand, 1.5 cm scar on back of 2nd and 3rd finger
Left Wrist, 2 cm scar on the back of the wrist

Case reference: 2014002868.CaseDesc: On August 2, 1989, Ronald Jack last spoke with his mother. During that telephone discussion, Ronald had informed her that he and his wife, Doreen Jack, would be leaving for a “camp job”. He had also said that they would be gone for approximately 10 days, and would be back before their sons, Russell and Ryan Jack, started their school year in September.

Case reference: 2014006186.CaseDesc: In 2003, Jack Gichuru Gatari last spoke to his sister and told her he was going to Toronto, Ontario, to find work. Jack had come to Canada in 1999 on a student visa to attend the University of Saskatchewan.

Case reference: 2018008230.CaseDesc: On September 1, 1993, Trevor Chase was seen for the last time by his relatives in Truro, Nova Scotia. Trevor’s family believed that he may have been residing in Vancouver, British Columbia, in 1994.

Case reference: 2013000115.CaseDesc: Gaby Luonga Kombe was last seen on August 23, 1999, in Montreal, Quebec. He had to go to Pie-IX metro station to meet a friend. Later in the evening, he called his son to tell him he was heading home. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014001575.CaseDesc: On March 12, 1983, Samuel Amos Quatell was reported missing from the fishing vessel “ISE II”, near Steep Island, BC. Steep Island is located near Seymour Narrows; between Quadra Island and Campbell River, BC. Samuel was last seen near the rear of the vessel, by the ship’s crew.  An extensive search failed to locate Samuel. The tidal currents near the island are extremely strong and any person in the water could travel a great distance in a short period of time.

Amputation: Left Hand, Missing tip of ring finger

Case reference: 2014019687.CaseDesc: On November 23, 2013, an unidentified partial male skull was found in a forested area along a power line in Anmore near Coquitlam, BC. The decedent has likely been missing for several years.

Deformity: Head, Fractured facial bones. Underwent surgery to his skull, possibly during the 1980s or 1990s

Case reference: 2018010996.CaseDesc: On February 25, 2018, at approximately 11:00pm, Ilya Platonov was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Ilya did not attend school the next morning.

Case reference: 2012020067.CaseDesc: Bonnie Polwarth went missing from Brandon, Manitoba, on March 15, 1995. She had been undergoing counselling at the Brandon Mental Health Centre at the time of her disappearance. She is thought to have walked out of the facility on her own the day she went missing. She was supposed to be at work at 2:00 p.m. that day, but she did not show up and has been missing ever since.  Bonnie may have a forearm tattoo.

Jacket: Cream, Ivory, With green and brown

Case reference: 2023018104.CaseDesc: Teri-Lynn Wilson was reported missing by her family on April 16th, 2023.  Teri-Lynn was last seen on April 13th, 2023 at the Fredericton Inn on Regent Street in Fredericton, New Brunswick.  Teri-Lynn's disappearance is thought to be suspicious and the consequence of foul play.

Hair: Brown, Dyed, Shoulder, Shoulder length, dyed brown hair
Jacket: Dark Blue, Dark blue hooded jacket
Jeans: Blue, Blue jeans with rip in knees
Tattoo: Unknown, Pink catfish on unknown forearm

Case reference: 2012020044.CaseDesc: On December 23, 1986, Rodney Sloat was seen for the last time, by his friends, in Strathcona County, Alberta. That evening, Rodney was having dinner at his friends’ residence, and had left on his snowmobile at approximately midnight. During the time of his disappearance, Rodney may have been despondent. All of his personal belongings, identification, and snowmobile were found at his residence.

Case reference: 2000000183.CaseDesc: Matthew was last seen at a truck stop in Sicamous in British Columbia, Canada.

Case reference: 2013000070.CaseDesc: On June 4, 1980, Serge Jobin was seen for the last time in the De Lorimier district of Montreal, Quebec. He may have taken a bus to New York City in the United States. Serge is hearing impaired and mute.

Case reference: 2014002517.CaseDesc: Hélène Laferrière was seen for the last time on November 4, 1976, in the Saint-Sacrement District in Quebec City, Quebec. Hélène has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2006003399.CaseDesc: On November 2, 2001, this male, was found in a sewer at 470 Lansdowne Avenue in Toronto. His ancestry is Caucasian, possibly Egyptian or mixed African/Caucasian. He had previous surgery of his left forearm, which had involved the implant of surgical plates. The numbers visible on the surgical plates could not be traced to a specific individual, however, it was determined that the lot was released some time after May 25, 1994. A MacDonald’s name tag with the name "Raymond" was found in the sewer, which may or may not be related to this individual.

Teeth: Visible Missing, Teeth were stained, which suggests he may have been a smoker,  his upper central incisors were also missing
Fractured/Broken Bones: Left Hip, recent fracture of left hip

Case reference: 2014004294.CaseDesc: On May 28, 2001, Jean-Paul Leroux was seen for the last time when he left his spouse’s residence in Montreal, Quebec.  His vehicle was located abandoned 7 days later in the parking lot of the Saint-Leonard shopping centre. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2012020054.CaseDesc: Glenn Colombe was last seen by his parents on June 28, 1989. At this time, he indicated to his parents he had a sore head which he said was the result of a fight he had been in earlier in the evening. He has not been seen since.

Hat: Cotton, White, philly flyers ball cap

Case reference: 2018015227.CaseDesc: On March 22, 2018, at approximately 1:00pm, Maria Ruiz Zein was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Maria boarded a flight to go to Colombia, but has not returned to Canada.

Case reference: 2006017499.CaseDesc: Michael McIntyre was last seen on April 7, 1994 at his home on Round Lake in Hagarty Township, approximately 10 km northwest of Killaloe, On. An extensive land search and follow up to leads have proved negative. Mr. McIntyre is formerly from Fort McMurray, Alberta. He came to live in Round Lake in December of 1993. He is an avid outdoor sportsman.

Case reference: 2006023299.CaseDesc: Edward Nelson was last seen on June 21, 1987, in South Bay on Lake Nipigon. He was on a fishing boat heading southwest to go fishing and failed to return.

Case reference: 2013000049.CaseDesc: On May 9, 2008, Jean-Francois Rousseau was seen for the last time near the Mont-Tremblant park in Quebec.

Shirt: Blue, White, Plaided dark and doubled
Scar: Forehead, vertical in the middle of the forehead

Case reference: 2016068711.CaseDesc: On September 30, 1969, an unidentified male was found 0.8 kilometres west of Sioux Lookout. His death appears to be self-inflicted

Case reference: 2015011636.CaseDesc: On June 20, 1998, a fisherman saw the body of a man floating in the St. Lawrence River in front of L'île aux Vaches.

Socks: White, Grey, white top and gray on bottom
Tattoo: Right Shoulder, sword and a cross

Case reference: 2008018099.CaseDesc: On May 18, 1974, at approximately 8:15 hours, Douglas Henderson and Alexander Korecki were canoeing in a 14 foot fiberglass canoe close to the shore in the area of Depot Harbor, Big Sound, in Georgian Bay. The canoe capsized approximately 500 feet away from the campsite.

Case reference: 2014003729.CaseDesc: On April 6, 1997, Céline Mercier was seen for the last time at her home in Levis, Quebec. Her vehicle was recovered near the Pierre-Laporte Bridge, which spans the cities of Levis and Quebec. Céline hasn’t been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2015011647.CaseDesc: On June 13, 1994, the body of a woman was found floating in the St. Lawrence River at St-Jean Baptiste Street in the Pointe aux Trembles area of Montreal. She took good care of her teeth and according to experts the body would have been in the water for about 4 months.

Shoes: Leather, Brown, Black, black pattern on the side and orthopedic supports in acrylic brown and red in both shoes
Scar: Chest, right and left breast surgery
Chest, has possibly undergone a partial ablation

Case reference: 2014005890.CaseDesc: On February 15, 2012, Marie Antoinette Carlson was seen for the last time in Edmonton, Alberta. Marie has been known to travel to Calgary, Alberta and Montreal, Quebec.

Case reference: 2010000198.CaseDesc: Tim Mason was known to be an avid walker, frequenting trails and off-road areas. He left his house on foot during the morning and never returned. Mr. Mason suffered from heart problems.

Hair: Black, Grey, Short, Salt and Pepper

Case reference: 2016064545.CaseDesc: On May 17, 2007, skeletal remains of a man were discovered in a farmer's field near the Athabasca River. It is possible that these remains came from the river. This individual did not have any upper teeth and likely wore dentures. The sacrum was deformed and there is a possibility that he walked with a limp.

Case reference: 2014006252.CaseDesc: On September 12, 2013, Meagan Rose Pilon was seen for the last time at her family home in Sudbury, Ontario. At the time of her disappearance, Meagan was living in the New Sudbury area. Police have not been able to rule out foul play in her disappearance.

Mark: Left Chest, Red birthmark on inner left breast

Case reference: 2014001410.CaseDesc: Emma Dixon was last seen on July 22, 1964 at her home on Union Bar Reserve, in Hope, British Columbia. Her husband said that she may have gone to Washington for work. Emma never told anyone she was leaving and did not take any personal belongings. She was reported missing on August 20, 1964.

Case reference: 2014003903.CaseDesc: Anthony Kootenay walked away from the Algar Tower fire camp 73 kilometres south of Fort McMurray, Alberta on July 13, 1985 at approximately 3:00 am. In the previous days he was described by colleagues as suffering from mental health issues related to alcohol abuse. It is believed he may have attempted to hitch-hike from the area as a passing motorist spotted someone matching his description. An extensive search by land and helicopter was conducted, however Anthony was not located. Two unconfirmed sightings occurred at the Grand Hotel in Edmonton, AB on December 23, 1985 and January 16, 1986. There have been no sightings since that time.

Shoes: Blue, Running shoes with no laces
Tattoo: Left Hand, Tony on the 4 fingers
Left Arm, A flower with 4 petals

Case reference: 2014005835.CaseDesc: Dexter Whitford was last seen April 29, 2004 by family in Edmonton, Alberta.  Dexter has tattoos on both his hands, a tear drop under his right eye and a buffalo skull with the name "Stella" on the right side of his neck.

Tattoo: Right Side Of Neck, Buffalo with "STELLA" inside

Case reference: 2016061153.CaseDesc: On April 20, 1996, a male was found on the shores of the Detroit River in the 800 block of Front Road North, Amherstburg. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 200 lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He is described as balding, however, due to the length of time spent in the water, it is possible that his hair was lost after death giving the appearance of male pattern baldness. He is uncircumcised. His appendix is present. Changes to his heart suggest that he had high blood pressure and may have been treated for this. It is believed that he was in the water for days to weeks prior to his discovery.

Jewelry: Gold, Timex, watch with a gold-plated spandex band on his left wrist
Sweater: Black, Dark Blue, Knights of Round Table, polo
Scar: Forehead, 3.8 cm on the right side

Case reference: 2014001943.CaseDesc: Kam Lee was last seen in the Bishop Grandin and River Road area of Winnipeg, MB.  Mr. Lee's whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2008023299.CaseDesc: In the early morning hours of June 30, 2001, Istefan Toma returned home after work. He showered, changed his clothes and was observed leaving the family home at approximately 1 a.m. in his own vehicle. It was later discovered he had taken his identification and citizenship card, but did not take any clothing or other belongings with him. His vehicle was recovered from a parking lot in the vicinity of his work place at Woodbridge Mall (Hwy 7/Martingrove, Woodbridge, Ontario) on the 11th of February 2002, having been parked there for approximately 6-9 months. Mr. Toma has not been in contact with any family members nor his employers since he left his home on the morning of June 30, 2001. Mr. Toma speaks broken English, is known to smoke DuMaurier cigarettes and has been known to attend casinos on occasion. Mr. Toma's family and the police are concerned for his safety and well-being.

Mark: Nose, Mole on the right side of the nose

Case reference: 2014004201.CaseDesc: Rodney Hicks was last seen at his residence at 1700hrs on March 3, 1989. Mr. Hicks has an intellectual disability. He suffered from epilepsy and autism.

Case reference: 2021033500.CaseDesc: On August 1, 2021, at approximately 2:40 p.m., Yaoschuwach Asselin was seen for the last time at his home in the Saint-Michel neighbourhood in Montreal, Quebec. Yaoschuwach left without taking any of his personal belongings, and he has not been seen or heard from since.

Hair: Brown, Wears beard and mustache, medium length hair

Case reference: 2014004320.CaseDesc: On February 22, 2002, Alexandre Fortin was seen for the last time in a home situated on road 127 in Saint-Georges, Quebec. Over the course of the night, a fire completely destroyed the residence and Alexandre remains missing, despite search operations.

Case reference: 2019052572.CaseDesc: On January 1, 1995, Bojan Stamenkovic was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Following his arrival to Canada from Serbia, Bojan was employed as a mechanical engineer, and a professor at the University of Toronto. Around the time of his disappearance, Bojan had informed his family that he would not be able to contact them for an extended period of time due to unknown reasons.

Case reference: 2006020399.CaseDesc: Lawrence Prettie was last seen on October 23, 1994. His boat capsized on Lac Seul and he is presumed drowned. His body has never been recovered.  His boat, camping and fishing gear were located strewn about on an island in Lac Seul.

Case reference: 2016066678.CaseDesc: On July 29, 1966, the remains of a male were recovered from the Maid of the Mist Landing, in Niagara Falls. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 175-180 lbs and his length was measured at 5'11", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.

Hair: Black, Short, Shorter than collar length, greying

Case reference: 2017061069.CaseDesc: On July 29, 1976, John Winer was seen for the last time as he sat on a railing near the falls in Niagara Falls, Ontario. Some of John’s personal belongings were found near the railing.

Case reference: 2014005882.CaseDesc: Romeo Cloutier was last seen September 13, 2012 in Moncton (NB). His vehicle was located in Sainte-Marie-de-Kent later on that same day. No other confirmed reports of his whereabouts have been made since.

Tattoo: Neck, Inscription "Keep your friends close, keep enemies closer"

Case reference: 2016069147.CaseDesc: On September 13, 1974, the body of a Caucasian male was found on the CNR tracks, 200 yards west of the CNR Station, Hearst. A witness observed the remains on the tracks after an advancing train had passed. His post-mortem length was recorded as being 5’8” however; this measurement may not represent his actual living height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He was described as having a medium build. He may have been wearing glasses according to police reports.

Teeth: Good, Missing upper left 3rd molar. Several of his upper and lower posterior teeth had amalgam restorations.

Case reference: 2014005236.CaseDesc: On May 30, 1973, Françoise Guilbault reportedly left her home in Joliette, Quebec. She left a note for her husband and took a bus to Montreal. She has never been seen since.

Case reference: 2014005921.CaseDesc: On June 19, 2012, at approximately noon, Diane Bonneau was seen for the last time at her residence in Saint-Félicien, Quebec. Diane hasn’t been seen and we haven’t heard from her since.

Case reference: 2008004299.CaseDesc: Ghazaros Allahverdioglu was boating with family on Fairy Lake in the town of Huntsville, Ontario.  He apparently fell off the boat by One Tree Island in Fairy Lake.

Case reference: 2014004635.CaseDesc: In 1986, Sarah Skunk visited with family members located in Mishkeegogamang First Nation and Shabaqua, ON. Since that time, she has not been heard from by any family members. Family fears that she may be deceased. Sarah was known to frequent Vancouver BC, Sudbury ON, and Washington State, USA. Sarah spent some time on the streets. She was known by numerous aliases and may have had children.

Mark: Mouth, Wart on inside of mouth

Case reference: 2014004330.CaseDesc: On the 27th of December, 2002, at approximately 9 a.m., Jaroslav Heindl was last seen by the Lakeshore IGA Food Store in Regina, SK. Mr. Heindl was known to collect discarded items from around stores and other locations. His vehicle was located nearby, however, searches and investigations have failed to locate him.

Case reference: 2012020127.CaseDesc: Jocelyne Dubé, 57, was last seen on October 2nd 2008. On the night of her disappearance, she received a phone call from a friend and a visit from her daughter at her Piedmont, Quebec residence.  A few days after the disappearance, her abandoned vehicle was found in Montreal, Quebec. Everything indicates that the car had been there for a few days.

Case reference: 2022055259.CaseDesc: Terry Ramsay was reported missing on October 31, 2022, from the community of Heron Springs, in Fredericton, New Brunswick. Terry's automobile was found in a forested area west of Fredericton on November 5, 2023. A ground search of the region yielded negative results, even with the assistance of drones and a helicopter.

Case reference: 2014001192.CaseDesc: On November 13, 1983, the partial remains of a young adult male were found on the south side of Cracroft Island. He was partially clothed in a wetsuit, and may have been out fishing when he went missing. The last joint of the little finger on his left hand was amputated. He is estimated to have gone missing sometime in 1982 or 1983.

Pants: Cloth, Gold, Small sweatpants with drawstring waist
Fractured/Broken Bones: Left Little Finger, Amputation of left pinky finger

Case reference: 2014005520.CaseDesc: On November 20, 2010, at approximately 5:00 p.m., Dina Bat-Og was seen for the last time leaving her home to go to work in Toronto, Ontario. Dina had advised that she would be returning home at midnight, but never returned.

Case reference: 2012020093.CaseDesc: On April 20, 2003, Garry Guenther, 58 years old, left his residence in the Hepburn district, SK. He was driving his white 1993 Ford F-150 truck with SK licence GGG. Mr. Guenther was reported to have been seen in Hoey, SK on the 23rd/ 24th of April, 2003, however, neither he nor his vehicle have been located.

Sweater: Cotton, Grey, sweat shirt with an image of a fish on the front
Deformity: Right Leg, bow-legged, walks with noticeable limp

Case reference: 2012020655.CaseDesc: On May 22, 2008, Wilson Grant Nokohoot was seen for the last time on the 1800 block of Smith Street, Regina, Saskatchewan. It is unusual for Mr. Nokohoot to not have regular contact with family and acquaintances.

Case reference: 2014004734.CaseDesc: Roland Langlois went missing from the Malartic hospital on August 13, 1978. He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2024035640.CaseDesc: Barry Auguste was last seen on February 9, 2024, in the area of Horner Ave and Evans Ave. He is known to be in the downtown area of Toronto, Ontario.
